body:
Here's what I get for the in-memory bitmap:

```
(gdb) dump-bitmap/44 0x18770000
18770000: 18c42380    184d8fff/0: scalar  marked/scan
18770004: 00000037    184d8fff/1: scalar  unmarked/dead
18770008: 18c42380    184d8fff/2: scalar  unmarked/dead
1877000c: 00000037    184d8fff/3: scalar  unmarked/dead
18770010: 00000007    184d8ffe/0: scalar  marked/scan
18770014: 00000001    184d8ffe/1: scalar  marked/scan
18770018: 00000000    184d8ffe/2: scalar  marked/scan
1877001c: 00000000    184d8ffe/3: scalar  marked/scan
18770020: 00000000    184d8ffd/0: scalar  marked/scan
18770024: ffffffff    184d8ffd/1: scalar  marked/scan
18770028: ffffffff    184d8ffd/2: scalar  marked/scan
1877002c: ffffffff    184d8ffd/3: scalar  marked/scan
18770030: 00000000    184d8ffc/0: scalar  marked/scan
18770034: 00000000    184d8ffc/1: scalar  marked/scan
18770038: 00000000    184d8ffc/2: scalar  marked/scan
1877003c: 00000000    184d8ffc/3: scalar  marked/scan
18770040: 00000000    184d8ffb/0: scalar  marked/scan
18770044: 00000000    184d8ffb/1: scalar  marked/scan
18770048: 00000008    184d8ffb/2: scalar  marked/scan
1877004c: 00000000    184d8ffb/3: scalar  marked/scan
18770050: 00000000    184d8ffa/0: pointer marked/scan
18770054: 18683ef0    184d8ffa/1: pointer marked/scan
18770058: 00000000    184d8ffa/2: pointer marked/scan
1877005c: 00000000    184d8ffa/3: pointer marked/scan
18770060: 00000000    184d8ff9/0: pointer marked/scan
18770064: 00000000    184d8ff9/1: pointer marked/scan
18770068: 00000000    184d8ff9/2: pointer marked/scan
1877006c: 00000000    184d8ff9/3: pointer marked/scan
18770070: 082316d0    184d8ff8/0: pointer marked/scan
18770074: 00000007    184d8ff8/1: scalar  marked/scan
18770078: 00000000    184d8ff8/2: pointer marked/scan
1877007c: 00000000    184d8ff8/3: scalar  marked/scan
18770080: 00000000    184d8ff7/0: pointer marked/scan
18770084: 00000000    184d8ff7/1: scalar  marked/scan
18770088: 00000000    184d8ff7/2: pointer marked/scan
1877008c: 00000000    184d8ff7/3: pointer marked/scan
18770090: 00000000    184d8ff6/0: pointer marked/scan
18770094: 18bd97f0    184d8ff6/1: pointer marked/scan
18770098: 00000008    184d8ff6/2: scalar  marked/scan
1877009c: 00000008    184d8ff6/3: scalar  marked/scan
187700a0: 18c52090    184d8ff5/0: pointer marked/scan
187700a4: 00000001    184d8ff5/1: scalar  unmarked/dead
187700a8: 00000001    184d8ff5/2: scalar  unmarked/dead
187700ac: 00000001    184d8ff5/3: scalar  unmarked/dead
```

Something is definitely wrong in the first bitmap byte. 18770000 and 18770008 should be pointers, and, while the first two bits are mark and checkmark, the third bit is a dead bit, so it won't scan past there. It looks like that bitmap byte got zeroed and then the object was marked.
